messages.content: What is the purpose of ostris_nodes_comfyui?
ostris_nodes_comfyui is a collection of custom nodes for ComfyUI that are designed to improve the quality of life and add more advanced functionality in the future.

To install ostris_nodes_comfyui, you need to git clone the repo into your ComfyUI 'custom_nodes' folder and restart. You also need to run 'pip install --upgrade -r requirements.txt' in the cloned directory.
What outputs does the 'One Seed' node provide?

The 'One Seed' node in ostris_nodes_comfyui provides the following outputs: seed (SEED), int (int), number (NUMBER), float (FLOAT), string (STRING), and zfill (STRING) which is zero filled to 16 digits.
What is the 'Text Box' node in ostris_nodes_comfyui?
The 'Text Box' node in ostris_nodes_comfyui is a simple textbox that provides two outputs: string (STRING) and text (TEXT).
What is the 'LLM Prompt Upsampling' feature based on?

The 'LLM Prompt Upsampling' feature in ostris_nodes_comfyui is based on the work of sayakpaul/caption-upsampling. It uses an LLM to expand a prompt into a more complex prompt with more descriptive detail.
What is the warning regarding the 'LLM Prompt Upsampling' feature?

The warning for the 'LLM Prompt Upsampling' feature in ostris_nodes_comfyui states that it is experimental and may remove TI embeddings. It also mentions that it loads in 4bit mode but will still be VRAM hungry.
What input does the 'LLM Pipe Loader' node require?
The 'LLM Pipe Loader' node in ostris_nodes_comfyui requires the input 'model_name' which is a string representing the Huggingface model name, for example, 'HuggingFaceH4/zephyr-7b-beta'.
